contentstabilization-desc: Allows users to mark pages as "approved" or "draft" and to view the most recent approved version of a page.
right-contentstabilization-oversight: See overview of all approvals of a page
right-contentstabilization-admin: Change who can see drafts, delete and change approvals
contentstabilization-global-action-overv: Overview of pages in the approval process
contentstabilization-pageinfoelement-pag: Draft due to changes in included resources
contentstabilization-ui-approve-notice: On approval, this draft version will replace the current approved version of the page. Do you want to accept the draft version?
contentstabilization-pref-handleinclude-: Versions that were current at the time of approval
contentstabilization-pref-handleincludes: Determines which version of included resources should be shown to the user when rendering an approved version of the page
content-stabilization-integration-activi: Cannot create a valid title from the "pageId" provided
Specified revision does not match the title specified
No valid user can be asserted to perform the approval
content-stabilization-integration-workfl: Specified user is invalid, or is not allowed approve a page
contentstabilization-pref-allowfirstunst: Allow viewing of first draft version for users who can normally not see drafts
contentstabilization-pref-stabilize-smw: Update semantic properties from approved versions only
contentstabilization-pref-allowfirstunst: If enabled, the first draft version of a page will be shown to users who would otherwise not be able to see draft versions
contentstabilization-pref-stabilize-smw-: If enabled, update of Semantic Mediawiki properties will be triggered only on stable versions of pages
contentstabilization-stablepoint-added-m: New approved version of the page available
added a new approved version of the page
contentstabilization-state-draft-resourc: Page is a draft due to changes in included resources
log-description-stabilization: Log listing changes to page stabilization
contentstabilization-overview-no-enabled: Approval is not enabled on any namespace
contentstabilization-overview-enabled: Approval is currently enabled for the following namespaces: $1
contentstabilization-document-state-sesp: The state of the page. Can be 'Approved' (latest version has been successfully reviewed), 'In revision' (there is a draft version of that page) or 'Approval requested' (a review workflow has been started on the existing draft version).
contentstabilization-approval-date-sesp-: The date and time of the successful review of that page
contentstabilization-approval-user-sesp-: The user that reviewed the page
contentstabilization-document-version-se: The number of approved revisions in the page history
contentstabilization-pref-index-stable: Index approved versions of pages only
contentstabilization-pref-pdf-show-tag: Show stabilization information in PDF export
contentstabilization-pref-export-list-st: Export: List approved pages contained in the book
contentstabilization-pref-export-list-un: Export: List not approved pages contained in the book
contentstabilization-pref-export-list-di: Export: List pages contained in the book that do not have stabilization enabled
contentstabilization-pref-draftgroups: Show not approved pages for following groups
contentstabilization-pref-draftgroups-he: Sets the access right to draft versions. Users in group sysop are always able to see the draft version.
